title: Leadership: Jared joining as co-leader
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Decision**: Jared Houghtaling joining Robert Miller as GIS Working Group co-leader.

**Action**: Approved by working group.

**Status**: Complete - announce in next meeting and update documentation.

**Labels**: management, decision

title: Leadership: Call for additional co-leaders
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Others interested in co-leadership roles should express interest to current co-leaders.

**How to Express Interest**:
- Attend Friday meeting and express interest
- Message co-leaders on Teams
- Email houghtaling@ohdsi.org

**Labels**: management

title: Poll group about alternative meeting times
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Robert to poll the working group about alternative meeting times to better accommodate members in different time zones.

**Method**: Asynchronously via Teams poll

**Timeline**: Before next meeting

**Labels**: meeting, coordination

title: Restart task-oriented GitHub project management
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Restart task-oriented structure on GitHub Project Board

**Details**:
- Allocate 10-15 minutes at start of each Friday meeting for ticket review
- Review current sprint tasks
- Update status on project board
- Identify blockers
- Assign new tasks

**Related**: https://github.com/orgs/OHDSI/projects/26

**Labels**: project-management, task

title: Jay to help coordinate project board structure
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Jay to help coordinate GitHub Project Board structure and workflows

**Related**: https://github.com/orgs/OHDSI/projects/26

**Labels**: project-management, task

title: Create repository inventory spreadsheet
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Robert to create spreadsheet listing all GIS Working Group repositories and branches

**Spreadsheet Contents**:
- Repository name and URL
- Active branches
- Current contents description
- Future vision for each repo
- Cleanup needs (old branches, etc.)

**Distribution**: Share via Teams and email link

**Repositories to include**:
- OHDSI/GIS
- OHDSI/gaiaDb
- OHDSI/gaiaCore
- OHDSI/gaiaCatalog
- OHDSI/gaiaDocker
- TuftsCTSI/CVB
- Any other related repos

**Labels**: documentation, coordination, task

title: Team to collaboratively document repo contents in inventory
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Once repository inventory spreadsheet is created, team members to collaboratively document current contents of each repo

**Depends on**: Repository inventory spreadsheet being created

**Labels**: documentation, task

title: Define future vision for each repository
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Define future vision for each GIS Working Group repository in the inventory spreadsheet

**Questions to answer**:
- What should this repository contain?
- What is its role in the toolchain?
- What are the inputs and outputs?
- How does it relate to other repos?

**Depends on**: Repository inventory spreadsheet being created

**Labels**: documentation, architecture, task

title: Create lightweight tickets for technical stack alignment
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Create lightweight GitHub issues for key technical questions to discuss asynchronously

**Key Questions to Address**:
1. What is Gaia Core? (inputs/outputs, role in toolchain)
2. Where does data get stored? (gaiaDb architecture)
3. How do repos fit together? (data flows, dependencies)

**Process**:
- Create individual issues for each question
- Discuss asynchronously via GitHub comments
- Decide in upcoming meetings
- Link to architecture documentation

**Labels**: architecture, discussion, task

title: Schedule vision workshop
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Schedule dedicated meeting to workshop GIS Working Group vision

**Agenda Items**:
- Revisit and refine mission statement
- Workshop group vision
- Define success criteria
- Ensure team alignment across all members

**Timing**: When Tim is available

**Duration**: Likely 90-120 minutes

**Labels**: vision, meeting, coordination

title: Specify minimum viable products (MVPs) across toolchain
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Define minimum viable products for each component of the Gaia toolchain

**Components to Define MVPs for**:
- gaiaDb
- gaiaCore
- gaiaCatalog
- gaiaDocker
- Vocabulary Package

**For Each MVP, Document**:
- Core features required
- Dependencies on other components
- Success criteria
- Timeline estimate

**Related**: Roadmap issues #365, #366, #368, #369

**Labels**: architecture, planning, task

title: Document dependencies between MVPs
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Document dependencies between minimum viable products across the toolchain

**Create Dependency Diagram**:
- Which MVPs depend on which others?
- What is the critical path?
- What can be developed in parallel?

**Depends on**: MVP definitions being completed

**Labels**: architecture, planning, documentation

title: Document deployment strategies (Docker, Podman, Ansible, manual)
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Ensure all deployment strategies are documented

**Deployment Methods to Document**:
- gaiaDocker (primary)
- Podman (daemonless)
- Ansible (infrastructure-as-code)
- Manual installation

**Status**: Already documented in developer-deployment.html

**Next Step**: Review for completeness and accuracy

**Labels**: documentation, deployment, task

title: Hayden to integrate Hopkins deployment work
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Hayden to integrate Hopkins deployment work into GIS documentation and/or gaiaDocker

**Details**: Hopkins has deployment strategies that should be incorporated into the broader GIS toolchain deployment documentation

**Labels**: deployment, task

title: Jacob to contribute onboarding documentation
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Jacob to contribute onboarding documentation based on new member experience

**Focus Areas**:
- New member experience
- Common questions from newcomers
- Setup challenges and solutions
- Onboarding improvements

**Framework**: Developer contributing guide already exists to build upon

**Labels**: documentation, onboarding, task

title: Update 'Getting Involved' page
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Update the 'Getting Involved' page with latest information

**Page**: rmd/getting-involved.Rmd

**Updates Needed**:
- Current leadership (co-leaders)
- Latest meeting information
- Updated processes
- Links to new developer resources

**Labels**: documentation, task

title: Jared to meet with Sarah Khalid re: scientific data submission
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Jared to meet with Sarah Khalid regarding scientific data journal submission

**Context**: GIS Working Group manuscript development

**Labels**: publication, coordination

title: Continue developing independent GIS manuscript
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Continue developing independent GIS Working Group manuscript

**Decision**: GIS group will publish separately (not as part of Florida study)

**Next Steps**:
- Define manuscript scope and outline
- Identify co-authors
- Establish writing timeline
- Determine target journal

**Labels**: publication, task

title: Respond to Florida team: GIS publishing separately
body:
**Meeting**: October 31, 2025

**Action**: Communicate to Florida team that GIS Working Group will publish manuscript separately

**Message**: GIS group appreciates the collaboration opportunity but will pursue an independent publication focused on the GIS toolchain and methodology

**Labels**: publication, communication
